content: Posted without editorial comment: Little Rock - One person is in custody, and two others have been transported to a local hospital in serious condition following a double-shooting in west Little Rock Monday morning. Authorities say the incident occurred around 10:00 a.m. at a U.S. Army Recruiting office at 9112 North Rodney Parham Road. According to Lt. Terry Hastings with the Little Rock Police Department, two recruiting officers standing outside the office were hit when the unidentified suspect drove up in a black SUV and began shooting. "http://www.democraticunderground.com/discuss/duboard.php?az=view_all&address=102x3902478"

content: This is a shame, real shame, a wasted loss but I have to make a personal opinion about why they were there. Home Town recruiters have been around since the 70s, I was one of the first, 6 months duty in New Orleans. I feel those troops right out of boot camp had no business being there in the first place. Show and Tell........tell what????? They didn't have any experience to pass on except Boot Camp. Life is totally different once you're out of Boot Camp, sometimes better but more times worse, especially getting the war experience. If this is what the Army is doing to get the ranks filled, they were way off the mark....IMO.

title: Shooting incident at Little Rock Recruiting Office

content: Posted without editorial comment: Little Rock - One person is in custody, and two others have been transported to a local hospital in serious condition following a double-shooting in west Little Rock Monday morning. Authorities say the incident occurred around 10:00 a.m. at a U.S. Army Recruiting office at 9112 North Rodney Parham Road. According to Lt. Terry Hastings with the Little Rock Police Department, two recruiting officers standing outside the office were hit when the unidentified suspect drove up in a black SUV and began shooting. "http://www.democraticunderground.com/discuss/duboard.php?az=view_all&address=102x3902478"

content: This is a shame, real shame, a wasted loss but I have to make a personal opinion about why they were there. Home Town recruiters have been around since the 70s, I was one of the first, 6 months duty in New Orleans. I feel those troops right out of boot camp had no business being there in the first place. Show and Tell........tell what????? They didn't have any experience to pass on except Boot Camp. Life is totally different once you're out of Boot Camp, sometimes better but more times worse, especially getting the war experience. If this is what the Army is doing to get the ranks filled, they were way off the mark....IMO.

content: Posted without editorial comment: Little Rock - One person is in custody, and two others have been transported to a local hospital in serious condition following a double-shooting in west Little Rock Monday morning. Authorities say the incident occurred around 10:00 a.m. at a U.S. Army Recruiting office at 9112 North Rodney Parham Road. According to Lt. Terry Hastings with the Little Rock Police Department, two recruiting officers standing outside the office were hit when the unidentified suspect drove up in a black SUV and began shooting. "http://www.democraticunderground.com/discuss/duboard.php?az=view_all&address=102x3902478"

content: This is a shame, real shame, a wasted loss but I have to make a personal opinion about why they were there. Home Town recruiters have been around since the 70s, I was one of the first, 6 months duty in New Orleans. I feel those troops right out of boot camp had no business being there in the first place. Show and Tell........tell what????? They didn't have any experience to pass on except Boot Camp. Life is totally different once you're out of Boot Camp, sometimes better but more times worse, especially getting the war experience. If this is what the Army is doing to get the ranks filled, they were way off the mark....IMO.

content: Posted without editorial comment: Little Rock - One person is in custody, and two others have been transported to a local hospital in serious condition following a double-shooting in west Little Rock Monday morning. Authorities say the incident occurred around 10:00 a.m. at a U.S. Army Recruiting office at 9112 North Rodney Parham Road. According to Lt. Terry Hastings with the Little Rock Police Department, two recruiting officers standing outside the office were hit when the unidentified suspect drove up in a black SUV and began shooting. "http://www.democraticunderground.com/discuss/duboard.php?az=view_all&address=102x3902478"

content: This is a shame, real shame, a wasted loss but I have to make a personal opinion about why they were there. Home Town recruiters have been around since the 70s, I was one of the first, 6 months duty in New Orleans. I feel those troops right out of boot camp had no business being there in the first place. Show and Tell........tell what????? They didn't have any experience to pass on except Boot Camp. Life is totally different once you're out of Boot Camp, sometimes better but more times worse, especially getting the war experience. If this is what the Army is doing to get the ranks filled, they were way off the mark....IMO.

content: Posted without editorial comment: Little Rock - One person is in custody, and two others have been transported to a local hospital in serious condition following a double-shooting in west Little Rock Monday morning. Authorities say the incident occurred around 10:00 a.m. at a U.S. Army Recruiting office at 9112 North Rodney Parham Road. According to Lt. Terry Hastings with the Little Rock Police Department, two recruiting officers standing outside the office were hit when the unidentified suspect drove up in a black SUV and began shooting. "http://www.democraticunderground.com/discuss/duboard.php?az=view_all&address=102x3902478"

content: This is a shame, real shame, a wasted loss but I have to make a personal opinion about why they were there. Home Town recruiters have been around since the 70s, I was one of the first, 6 months duty in New Orleans. I feel those troops right out of boot camp had no business being there in the first place. Show and Tell........tell what????? They didn't have any experience to pass on except Boot Camp. Life is totally different once you're out of Boot Camp, sometimes better but more times worse, especially getting the war experience. If this is what the Army is doing to get the ranks filled, they were way off the mark....IMO.

content: Posted without editorial comment: Little Rock - One person is in custody, and two others have been transported to a local hospital in serious condition following a double-shooting in west Little Rock Monday morning. Authorities say the incident occurred around 10:00 a.m. at a U.S. Army Recruiting office at 9112 North Rodney Parham Road. According to Lt. Terry Hastings with the Little Rock Police Department, two recruiting officers standing outside the office were hit when the unidentified suspect drove up in a black SUV and began shooting. "http://www.democraticunderground.com/discuss/duboard.php?az=view_all&address=102x3902478"

content: This is a shame, real shame, a wasted loss but I have to make a personal opinion about why they were there. Home Town recruiters have been around since the 70s, I was one of the first, 6 months duty in New Orleans. I feel those troops right out of boot camp had no business being there in the first place. Show and Tell........tell what????? They didn't have any experience to pass on except Boot Camp. Life is totally different once you're out of Boot Camp, sometimes better but more times worse, especially getting the war experience. If this is what the Army is doing to get the ranks filled, they were way off the mark....IMO.

content: Posted without editorial comment: Little Rock - One person is in custody, and two others have been transported to a local hospital in serious condition following a double-shooting in west Little Rock Monday morning. Authorities say the incident occurred around 10:00 a.m. at a U.S. Army Recruiting office at 9112 North Rodney Parham Road. According to Lt. Terry Hastings with the Little Rock Police Department, two recruiting officers standing outside the office were hit when the unidentified suspect drove up in a black SUV and began shooting. "http://www.democraticunderground.com/discuss/duboard.php?az=view_all&address=102x3902478"

content: This is a shame, real shame, a wasted loss but I have to make a personal opinion about why they were there. Home Town recruiters have been around since the 70s, I was one of the first, 6 months duty in New Orleans. I feel those troops right out of boot camp had no business being there in the first place. Show and Tell........tell what????? They didn't have any experience to pass on except Boot Camp. Life is totally different once you're out of Boot Camp, sometimes better but more times worse, especially getting the war experience. If this is what the Army is doing to get the ranks filled, they were way off the mark....IMO.
reply: This is a shame, real shame, a wasted loss but I have to make a personal opinion about why they were there. Home Town recruiters have been around since the 70s, I was one of the first, 6 months duty in New Orleans. I feel those troops right out of boot camp had no business being there in the first place. Show and Tell........tell what????? They didn't have any experience to pass on except Boot Camp. Life is totally different once you're out of Boot Camp, sometimes better but more times worse, especially getting the war experience. If this is what the Army is doing to get the ranks filled, they were way off the mark....IMO.

content: Posted without editorial comment: Little Rock - One person is in custody, and two others have been transported to a local hospital in serious condition following a double-shooting in west Little Rock Monday morning. Authorities say the incident occurred around 10:00 a.m. at a U.S. Army Recruiting office at 9112 North Rodney Parham Road. According to Lt. Terry Hastings with the Little Rock Police Department, two recruiting officers standing outside the office were hit when the unidentified suspect drove up in a black SUV and began shooting. "http://www.democraticunderground.com/discuss/duboard.php?az=view_all&address=102x3902478"

content: This is a shame, real shame, a wasted loss but I have to make a personal opinion about why they were there. Home Town recruiters have been around since the 70s, I was one of the first, 6 months duty in New Orleans. I feel those troops right out of boot camp had no business being there in the first place. Show and Tell........tell what????? They didn't have any experience to pass on except Boot Camp. Life is totally different once you're out of Boot Camp, sometimes better but more times worse, especially getting the war experience. If this is what the Army is doing to get the ranks filled, they were way off the mark....IMO.

content: Posted without editorial comment: Little Rock - One person is in custody, and two others have been transported to a local hospital in serious condition following a double-shooting in west Little Rock Monday morning. Authorities say the incident occurred around 10:00 a.m. at a U.S. Army Recruiting office at 9112 North Rodney Parham Road. According to Lt. Terry Hastings with the Little Rock Police Department, two recruiting officers standing outside the office were hit when the unidentified suspect drove up in a black SUV and began shooting. "http://www.democraticunderground.com/discuss/duboard.php?az=view_all&address=102x3902478"

content: This is a shame, real shame, a wasted loss but I have to make a personal opinion about why they were there. Home Town recruiters have been around since the 70s, I was one of the first, 6 months duty in New Orleans. I feel those troops right out of boot camp had no business being there in the first place. Show and Tell........tell what????? They didn't have any experience to pass on except Boot Camp. Life is totally different once you're out of Boot Camp, sometimes better but more times worse, especially getting the war experience. If this is what the Army is doing to get the ranks filled, they were way off the mark....IMO.

content: Posted without editorial comment: Little Rock - One person is in custody, and two others have been transported to a local hospital in serious condition following a double-shooting in west Little Rock Monday morning. Authorities say the incident occurred around 10:00 a.m. at a U.S. Army Recruiting office at 9112 North Rodney Parham Road. According to Lt. Terry Hastings with the Little Rock Police Department, two recruiting officers standing outside the office were hit when the unidentified suspect drove up in a black SUV and began shooting. "http://www.democraticunderground.com/discuss/duboard.php?az=view_all&address=102x3902478"

content: This is a shame, real shame, a wasted loss but I have to make a personal opinion about why they were there. Home Town recruiters have been around since the 70s, I was one of the first, 6 months duty in New Orleans. I feel those troops right out of boot camp had no business being there in the first place. Show and Tell........tell what????? They didn't have any experience to pass on except Boot Camp. Life is totally different once you're out of Boot Camp, sometimes better but more times worse, especially getting the war experience. If this is what the Army is doing to get the ranks filled, they were way off the mark....IMO.

content: Posted without editorial comment: Little Rock - One person is in custody, and two others have been transported to a local hospital in serious condition following a double-shooting in west Little Rock Monday morning. Authorities say the incident occurred around 10:00 a.m. at a U.S. Army Recruiting office at 9112 North Rodney Parham Road. According to Lt. Terry Hastings with the Little Rock Police Department, two recruiting officers standing outside the office were hit when the unidentified suspect drove up in a black SUV and began shooting. "http://www.democraticunderground.com/discuss/duboard.php?az=view_all&address=102x3902478"

content: This is a shame, real shame, a wasted loss but I have to make a personal opinion about why they were there. Home Town recruiters have been around since the 70s, I was one of the first, 6 months duty in New Orleans. I feel those troops right out of boot camp had no business being there in the first place. Show and Tell........tell what????? They didn't have any experience to pass on except Boot Camp. Life is totally different once you're out of Boot Camp, sometimes better but more times worse, especially getting the war experience. If this is what the Army is doing to get the ranks filled, they were way off the mark....IMO.

content: Posted without editorial comment: Little Rock - One person is in custody, and two others have been transported to a local hospital in serious condition following a double-shooting in west Little Rock Monday morning. Authorities say the incident occurred around 10:00 a.m. at a U.S. Army Recruiting office at 9112 North Rodney Parham Road. According to Lt. Terry Hastings with the Little Rock Police Department, two recruiting officers standing outside the office were hit when the unidentified suspect drove up in a black SUV and began shooting. "http://www.democraticunderground.com/discuss/duboard.php?az=view_all&address=102x3902478"

content: This is a shame, real shame, a wasted loss but I have to make a personal opinion about why they were there. Home Town recruiters have been around since the 70s, I was one of the first, 6 months duty in New Orleans. I feel those troops right out of boot camp had no business being there in the first place. Show and Tell........tell what????? They didn't have any experience to pass on except Boot Camp. Life is totally different once you're out of Boot Camp, sometimes better but more times worse, especially getting the war experience. If this is what the Army is doing to get the ranks filled, they were way off the mark....IMO.

content: Posted without editorial comment: Little Rock - One person is in custody, and two others have been transported to a local hospital in serious condition following a double-shooting in west Little Rock Monday morning. Authorities say the incident occurred around 10:00 a.m. at a U.S. Army Recruiting office at 9112 North Rodney Parham Road. According to Lt. Terry Hastings with the Little Rock Police Department, two recruiting officers standing outside the office were hit when the unidentified suspect drove up in a black SUV and began shooting. "http://www.democraticunderground.com/discuss/duboard.php?az=view_all&address=102x3902478"

content: This is a shame, real shame, a wasted loss but I have to make a personal opinion about why they were there. Home Town recruiters have been around since the 70s, I was one of the first, 6 months duty in New Orleans. I feel those troops right out of boot camp had no business being there in the first place. Show and Tell........tell what????? They didn't have any experience to pass on except Boot Camp. Life is totally different once you're out of Boot Camp, sometimes better but more times worse, especially getting the war experience. If this is what the Army is doing to get the ranks filled, they were way off the mark....IMO.

content: Posted without editorial comment: Little Rock - One person is in custody, and two others have been transported to a local hospital in serious condition following a double-shooting in west Little Rock Monday morning. Authorities say the incident occurred around 10:00 a.m. at a U.S. Army Recruiting office at 9112 North Rodney Parham Road. According to Lt. Terry Hastings with the Little Rock Police Department, two recruiting officers standing outside the office were hit when the unidentified suspect drove up in a black SUV and began shooting. "http://www.democraticunderground.com/discuss/duboard.php?az=view_all&address=102x3902478"

content: This is a shame, real shame, a wasted loss but I have to make a personal opinion about why they were there. Home Town recruiters have been around since the 70s, I was one of the first, 6 months duty in New Orleans. I feel those troops right out of boot camp had no business being there in the first place. Show and Tell........tell what????? They didn't have any experience to pass on except Boot Camp. Life is totally different once you're out of Boot Camp, sometimes better but more times worse, especially getting the war experience. If this is what the Army is doing to get the ranks filled, they were way off the mark....IMO.
